channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Go urges government to initiate ‘balik probinsiya’ programs
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Bong Go appealed to the national government to prepare “balik probinsiya” programs by providing incentives and livelihood opportunities to Filipinos who wish to relocate to the provinces after the state of public health emergency and the enhanced community quarantine measures are lifted.

item.title: Guidelines on returning OFWs sought
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: The government task force on the coronavirus disease 2019 has ordered concerned agencies to come up with guidelines on returning Filipino migrant workers.

item.title: DOH eyes shorter work hours for health workers
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: The Department of Health is eyeing shorter working hours for healthcare workers as part of the measures to curb the rising prevalence of coronavirus disease 2019 among doctors, nurses and other frontliners in the fight against the pandemic.

item.title: IATF-issued IDs valid at quarantine checkpoints
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: While the government is implementing the RapidPass System, law enforcers manning quarantine checkpoints should honor the identification cards issued previously by the Inter-Agency Task Force on the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: World Bank OKs $100 million Philippines loan
item.author: Czeriza Valencia
item.description: The World Bank has announced approval of a fresh $100-million loan for the Philippines’ COVID-19 Emergency Response Project, specifically to help the country address the urgent needs of the healthcare sector.

item.title: ‘Trolls threat to future of global journalism’
item.author: Artemio Dumlao
item.description: Troll armies linked to President Duterte were cited among modern-day instruments used as “a weapon of disinformation on social media” that in a way, threaten the future of journalism in the world.

item.title: 2GO won’t accept payment for use of quarantine ships
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: Logistics firm 2GO will not accept the P35 million the government intends to pay for using two passenger vessels as quarantine ships.

item.title: New rules hamper SAP distribution
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: Local government units are facing issues associated with new rules regarding the social amelioration program (SAP), which hampered the distribution of the financial assistance for the poorest families.

item.title: 500 Pinoy patients to join initial COVID drug trial
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: About 500 coronavirus disease 2019 patients in the country are set to participate in the solidarity clinical trial to find effective drugs against an infection.

item.title: Nograles out, Roque in as IATF spokesman
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Cabinet Secretary Karlo Nograles has been eased out as spokesman of the Inter-Agency Task Force on Emerging Infectious Diseases after presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. and his team moved to centralize in his office all data and information related to the government’s efforts to fight the coronavirus disease 2019.
